item.title: Report X-2025060566
item.description:
Report X-2025060566

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: GREER
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02/25/2025 at approximately 0645, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification from operations staff at the ramp facility in Greer, SC that the outer packaging of a shipment containing a declared Class 3 dangerous goods commodity was observed to be damp. The shipment consisted of one outer fiberboard box that contained one inner plastic bottle. Initially, the shipment was reported as sustaining outer package damage only with the damp outer packaging believed to result from an unknown external substance. However, when arranging for final disposition of the package on 6/5/2025, a visible tear in the tape used to secure the top onto the lid observed that had not been previously documented, changing the determination that the initial reported damp outer packaging. may have resulted from a small amount of leakage from the cap inner bottle.

item.title: Report X-2025060462
item.description:
Report X-2025060462

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-04
  • City: NORTH CHARLESTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Operation Supervisor states that driver Carmen Romano was on a forklift unloading a pallet into the hazmat bay when he struck a pallet of UN3066, PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, 8, PG II which spilled about 2 gallons onto Bay #4 (hazmat bay). ABF Supervisor states none of it had hit the yard. ABF Super visor states that she put down some duntage to stop the spill from additionally spreading. ABF Supervisor states that it looks like 2 pails might have been impacted but one is actively leaking. Safety contacted CURA and they had problems trying to find a vendor in the area that was available. CURA s tated that they contacted vendor First Call Environmental (FCE) that would be able to get on-site at the soonest as 3.5 hours. ABF Supervisor states that she would be going home but her dock hand Marcus Parson would be able to let the spill team in and service the spill.

item.title: Report E-2025060195
item.description:
Report E-2025060195

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: LATTA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PETROLEUM TRANSPORT COMPANY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 357671
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver failed to slow for traffic and lost control of tanker unit resulting in rollover and product spill. Spill was caused by punctures in the wall of the tanker trailer. Duration of the release was approximately 3 hours due to Driver being transported by EMS for suspected injury. FD and envorimnental cleanup crew responded to contain and stop releasae.
